body: I agree. On that note im eye'ing Boeing ; (to big to fail / us military) @ $160 30% pre pandemic price, as well as other airlines. Basically the same reasons as you. I noticed while looking at the tech sector there is a distinguishable pattern each year to Seagate stock. Take a look let me know what you think.

author: 1ScruffyGeek
body:
If you don't mind my asking - and don't take this as me disputing them as a good investment, but, why Western Digital? 

With the rise of phones and the decline of consumer PCs (except for gaming PCs), I was holding off on investing for now.

Their failure rate in the BackBlaze Q2 2020 report are alright, but it looks like Seagate is beating them. https://www.backblaze.com/blog/backblaze-hard-drive-stats-q3-2020/

author: koolbklyn
body: What are peoples thoughts on STX. Earnings are coming up today after hours

author: Ironleg01
body: I was not too impressed with him on investor calls and investor days interviews he doesn't seem to know the products or WDC technologies well. Although maybe that's unfair considering he joined not that long ago. Although when you listen to interview with Seagate CEO he really knows his products well. People in the company also don't seem to like him much but maybe it's just people who are sour about something else. Also, Seagate CEO last summer (when Huawei bans happened) was like, yea we are selling all we can to China, HDDs are not on the list of banned technologies. Meanwhile WDC CEO was like, yea maybe we will sell  some if US Gov allows us but we will have to see. Did not inspire confidence in him.

author: SleezyTangoRomance
body: No you’re correct that bullish up trends make calls go up but look at the gamma the rate of change of delta it’s .01 so for every $1 stock goes up it’ll change delta. But look at the 1m chart it doesn’t show a bullish pattern. STX generally moves in a channel, take a look at T calls for the same exp and its chart you’ll see similarities

author: moltch
body:
Go on investing.com then go to STX. Look at historical data. Look at the day by day. I doubt you can find a single one week period where STX went up 12% which is what you need for that option to break even. 

That 50 bucks would be much much better spent on a weekly in the money call debit spread on apple. Pay 50 or 60 bucks for a $100 payoff.

author: value_bets_only
body:
Some more things on WDC for those interested

Seagate and WD are effectively a duopology in the HDD space.

STX is trading at 68.04

WDC is trading at 51.88 at time of writing

&#x200B;

WDC posted 12.691 billion in revenue TTM (trailing 12 months)

STX posted 10.172 billion in revenue TTM.

&#x200B;

Based on shares outstanding STX is trading on a 1.69 multiple of revenue with a 26.5% profit margin

WDC has a 30.9% profit margin on revenue. Based on shares outstanding and the revenue alone the market value of this stock is $70.78. That isn't considering the higher profit margin, their new earnings which will beat expectations, and their investments in furthering the disk storage on a single drive.

[https://www.earningswhispers.com/stocks/wdc](https://www.earningswhispers.com/stocks/wdc)  

Analysts predict 0.51 EPS -- all bets point to 0.67 could be roughly a \~30% surprise

FYI Seagate also surprised earnings by \~13%
